Topic: Illustrate plants with and without water and light.
Evidence Statements: The student can draw a plant that has plenty of water and light, showing it looking healthy and growing well.
The student can draw a plant that does not have enough water, showing it looking wilted or dry.
The student can draw a plant that does not have enough light, showing it looking weak or not growing well.
The student can use their drawings to show the pattern that plants need both water and light to live and grow.
The student can explain through their drawings how the presence or absence of water and light affects plant growth.
